paragraphs.text:
%md
## Locality Sensitive Hashing (LSH)
* Hash items into multiple buckets
* Similar items will hash to overlapping buckets over many different hash functions

![Locality Sensitive Hashing](http://fluxcapacitor.com/img/locality-sensitive-hashing.png) 

### Intuition: _Avoid cartesian_ and compare only items within each bucket

paragraphs.title: Convert CSV-based DataFrame into MinHashTaggedItems
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.sql.Row
import com.advancedspark.ml.MinHashTaggedItem
import com.twitter.algebird.{ MinHasher, MinHasher32, MinHashSignature }

val numHashes = 10
val minApproxLSHSimilarityThreshold = 1
val numBands = MinHasher.pickBands(minApproxLSHSimilarityThreshold, numHashes)

val minHasher = new MinHasher32(numHashes, numBands)

val itemsRDD = itemsDF.select($"id", $"title", $"tags").map(row => {
  val id = row.getInt(0)
  val title = row.getString(1)
  val tags = row.getString(2).trim.split("\\|")
  val tagSignatures = tags.map(tag => minHasher.init(tag))
  val combinedTagSignature = minHasher.sum(tagSignatures)
  
  MinHashTaggedItem(id, title, tags, combinedTagSignature)
}).cache()

val itemsCount = itemsRDD.count()

paragraphs.title: Cluster Items By Similarity using Power Iteration Clustering
Enrich the cluster assignments
paragraphs.text:
val clusterAssignmentsRDD = clusteringModel.assignments.map { assignment =>
  (assignment.id, assignment.cluster)
}

val enrichedClusterAssignmentsDF = clusterAssignmentsRDD.toDF("itemId", "clusterId")
  .join(itemsDF, $"itemId" === $"id")
  .select($"clusterId", $"itemId", $"title", $"tags")
  .sort($"clusterId" desc)
  
z.show(enrichedClusterAssignmentsDF.select($"clusterId", $"title", $"tags"))
